decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the installation of any external plant at any of the unit/s hereby approved, an acoustic report for the relevant unit/s shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that the rating level of the noise determined by the cumulative sound emissions of any external plant and/or equipment shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation.  The noise levels shall be measured or predicted 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade.  Measurements and assessment shall be made according to British Standard 4142:2014Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to installation of any kitchen extraction plant, a scheme for the extraction and dispersal of all fumes and odours arising from the development (including details of its method of construction, odour control measures, noise levels, its appearance and its finish) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and then implemented in full. The measures which form the approved scheme shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, an acoustic barrier having a superficial weight not less than 10kg/m2 with a height of not less than 3m shall be erected, as shown on the Proposed Site Plan (Drawing Number C-233-TP-02 Rev L), and thereafter permanently retained.Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring properties

Prior to its installation, details of any external lighting associated with the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with those details as may be approved. Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development and the amenity of neighbouring properties

1. Within 6 months of commencement of the development, a BREEAM 'Outstanding' feasibility report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority setting out what reasonable efforts have been made to achieve BREEAM Outstanding.2. No later than 6 months after occupation of the development, a Post Construction Certificate verifying that at least 'Excellent' BREEAM (or 'Outstanding as may be the case depending on part (1) above) level has been achieved unless otherwise agreed in writing beforehand, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energy

Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved (unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority), a Secured by Design final certificate or its equivalent from the Designing Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the National Police Chiefs Council shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order to achieve the principles and objectives of Secured by Design to improve community safety and crime prevention in accordance with Policy CS 14 of Kingston Core Strategy: Safer Communities, Policy DM 22 Design for Safety and Policy D11 Designing out Crime of the London Plan 2021.

Prior to occupation of any of the unit's hereby approved, the pedestrian footways and crossings, as indicated on C-233-TP-02-L - Proposed SIte Plan, shall be demarcated, be ready for use, and be thereafter retained.Reason: In the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No mezzanine floors shall be installed within any of the unit/s hereby permitted, other than those shown on the approved plans, without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies D3, SI1, T4, T6 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 and DM 10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

There shall be no use of the amenity space and seating areas, as indicated on C-233-TP-02-L - Proposed SIte Plan, between the hours of 18:00 and 07:00 Monday to Sunday.Reason: In the interests of the amenity of neighbouring properties

Vehicles shall be prohibited to speed limits of no more than 10 mph within the site. Prior to occupation of the development, appropriate signage indicating maximum speed limits within the site (10 mph) shall be installed and maintained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies D3, SI1, T4, T6 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 and DM 10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the occupation of any of the unit/s hereby approved, details of counter sales for the associated unit/s, including the associated proportion of floorspace and commercial sales, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Any counter sales shall form an ancillary part of the overall use of each unit. Reason: To prevent a retail use from being established and to ensure the Transport Assessment is a fair representation of the proposed development

Suitable space shall be reserved on site to allow the necessary infrastructure required to allow the future connection to a district heating network (should one become available) in accordance with the details indicated on drawing number 6038-CBC-00-XX-DR-U-96006 - I03 - Scope of Works to Enable Future District Heating Connection and Technical Note (6068-CBC-MP-TN-M-001, 17 November 2022) and shall be maintained thereafter. Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energy.

Prior to installation, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:10 / 1:5 of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:- Signage boards etcThe developer shall submit a site plan / elevation and key plans / elevations where applicable associated with each detail identifying the location of each typical detail.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development

No parking, idling, loading or unloading of any vehicles shall be permitted on the access road immediately to the rear of Advantage Nursery. Prior to occupation of any of the unit/s hereby approved, a scheme detailing measures to prevent the parking, idling and any loading/unloading of any vehicles in this area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.The development shall not be occupied other than in accordance with the approved scheme and shall be retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies D3, SI1, T4, T6 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 and DM 10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the approved detailed plans (C-233-TP-16 - window jamb details; C-233-TP-17 - ground floor window cill and head details; C-233-TP-18 - First floor window cill and head details) and shall be retained thereafter. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of the facing brick to be utilised in the development (Units 8 / 9 as shown on Proposed Site Plan - Drawing Number C-233-TP-02 Rev L), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to installation, details of the location, layout and specification of Photovoltaic Panels to be installed on the roof of the buildings shall be submitted for approval by the Local Planning Authority and shall be installed prior to occupation and maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energy

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with drawings Planting Layout North - 849.29.13 Rev A (October 2022) and Planting Layout South - 849.19.14 (October 2022) and the Landscape and Ecological Management Plan (Aspect Ecology, June 2022), which shall be implemented within the first planting season following substantial completion of the development, other than the hedge planting along the nursery boundary which shall be planted prior to commencement of the development as indicated on Planting Layout North - 849.29.13 Rev A October 2022. The tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for a period of five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and in accordance with a landscaping maintenance scheme which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of above ground works. Any trees or shrubs which die, are removed or become diseased during this period shall be replaced during the following planting season, and the areas shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose. Alterations to the landscaping scheme must be agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Environmental Management Plan Version G - 20 02 2023 (Chancery Gate). Construction vehicle access to the site shall be solely from the access points identified on the Site Plan - Routing (J32-5765-SK-001) in the Construction Environmental Management Plan and there shall be no parking, idling, loading or unloading of any vehicles (including construction and site contractor vehicles) permitted in the area to the rear of Advantage Nursery (indicated in yellow). A construction delivery booking system shall be in operation at all times with no construction deliveries during the AM (08:00-10:00) and PM (15:00-18:00) peak network periods (Monday to Friday), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved measures shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work on site and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Dust Management Plan Issue 2 (TRC, August 2022).The approved measures, including the Real-time Dust and Air Quality Monitoring set out in section 7.2 of the above DMP, shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work on site and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The hours of working during the demolition and construction phase shall be restricted to the following, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority:Monday - Friday: 8am - 6pmSaturday: 8am - 1pmNo working on Sundays or Bank Holidays.Reason: To safeguard the amenity of the occupants of surrounding premises during the demolition/construction phase.

There shall be no operational deliveries by Heavy Goods Vehicles over 7.5 tonnes outside the hours of 07:00 and 22:00 Monday to Saturdays and 07:00 and 20:00 on Sundays and Bank Holidays, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.A delivery booking system shall be in operation at all times with no operational deliveries during the AM (08:00-10:00) and PM (16:00-18:00) peak network periods (Monday to Friday), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the amenity of the occupants of surrounding premises

The refuse and recycling facilities as shown on the approved plans (C-233-TP-02 Rev L) shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy SI17 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The cycle parking facilities for a minimum of 26 no. long stay bicycle spaces and 10 no. external short stay spaces, as shown on the approved plans (C-233-TP-02 Rev L) shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates. At least 5% of the long and short stay cycle parking spaces shall be for larger and adapted cycles.Prior to installation, details of the Internal and external short stay cycle parking facilities (including 5% for larger and adapted cycles) to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to occupation of any of the unit/s hereby approved, an operational management plan for the relevant unit/s shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, setting out how the following will be controlled:i.              How operations will be strictly limited to within the relevant unit with no use of outside areas excluding for deliveriesii.     Ensuring all windows, doors and roller shutters (excluding for deliveries) remain closed between the hours of 19:00 and 07:00 (Monday-Sunday) iii.        Ensuring no amplified sound or music to be audible outside of the unit/siv.            How external lighting will be controlled between the hours of 19:00 and 07:00The relevant unit/s shall be occupied in accordance with the measures and mitigation set out in the approved Operational Management Plan which shall be retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies D3, SI1 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The unit/s hereby approved shall not be occupied other than in strict accordance with the Delivery Noise Management Plan (TRC, May 2022).Where specified in Section 3 of the Delivery Noise Management Plan, logs / checklists for the relevant unit/s shall be recorded on a daily basis for a minimum rolling 1 year period. Copies of the logs/checklists shall be kept on site and produced to the Council for inspection (when requested).The approved plan / measures shall be implemented prior to occupation of any unit/s hereby approved, and shall be retained thereafter. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies D3, SI1 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Delivery and Servicing Management Plan (Mode Transport Planning, May 2022) with the approved measures / plan implemented in full prior to occupation of any of the unit/s hereby approved and retained thereafter. Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), the premises shall only be used for the purposes specified in the application documents and for no other purposes whatsoever (including any other purposes falling within Class B or E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that class in any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification).Reason: The acceptability of the development is highly dependent upon the exact nature of the use of the site and other uses, whether within the same use class or permitted by the General Permitted Development Order, are unlikely to be acceptable in planning terms.

Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, Units 6 and 7, as indicated on the Proposed Site Plan (Drawing Number C-233-TP-02 Rev L) shall not be occupied other than in Use Class E(g)(iii) Industrial Processes or B8 Storage and Distribution of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that class in any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification).Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies D3, SI1 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No more than two of the commercial units hereby approved, as indicated on the Proposed Site Plan (Drawing Number C-233-TP-02 Rev L),  of the maximum combined size of 1393.55sqm (15,000sqf) shall be amalgamated, and no more than two sets of two units shall be combined in total across the site without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies D3, SI1 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Arboricultural Impact Assessment (Aspect Arboriculture, May 2022 11454_AIA.001 Rev A) and Tree Protection Plan (Aspect Arboriculture, May 2022 11454 TPP 01 (2/2) - Rev A). The approved measures shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work on site and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the ecological enhancements, mitigation and recommendations set out in the Landscape and Ecological Management Plan (LEMP) (Aspect Ecology, June 2022) and Ecological Appraisal (EA) (Aspect Ecology, July 2022), to include (but not limited to):- Mitigation Measures and Ecological enhancements set out in Section 6 of the EA and Section 5, Section 6 and Plan 6301/LEMP1 and Appendix 6301/2 of the LEMP- Ecological Management and maintenance as set out in Section 7 and Appendix 6301/5 of the LEMPThe approved scheme shall be implemented in full prior to beneficial occupation of the development and maintained thereafter.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall achieve as a minimum 102% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions over Part L of the Building Regulations (2013) secured on site as declared in the submitted Energy Assessment (Cudd Bentley (12 May 2022).Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates (unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority), evidence showing that the development has achieved the above improvements in CO2 emissions and internal water usage rates of no greater than 105L per person per day shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Once approved, any measures necessary to meet the targets shall be maintained throughout the lifetime of the development.Reason: To ensure compliance with the approved  energy strategy and in the interests of sustainability and energy conservation, in accordance with policy SI2 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS1, DM3 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No gas fired boilers shall be installed and operated at any of the units hereby approved without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority. Reason: In the interests of air quality, in accordance with policy SI1 of the London Plan 2021.

All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/."Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies D3, SI1 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The car parking shown on the approved plans shall be provided with a hard-bound, adequately-drained, dust-free surface prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained and kept free from obstruction thereafter. It shall not be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of and visitors to the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Car Parking Management Plan (Mode Transport Planning, May 2022) with the approved measures / plan implemented in full prior to occupation of any of the unit/s hereby approved and retained thereafter. Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Eighteen (18 no.) car parking space(s) shall be provided with active provision for electric vehicle charging points with the remainder (31 no.) provided with passive provision.Prior to any occupation of the development hereby approved, the approved scheme shall be installed, be ready for use, and be thereafter retained.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

(A) The development shall not be occupied other than in accordance with the drainage strategy set out in Flood Risk Assessment prepared by I & L Consulting Limited (23rd May 2022) and 'Applicant Response to LLFA Consultation' document (I & L Consulting Limited dated 21/06/2022).(B) No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the approved sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.The system shall be implemented and thereafter managed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan 2021, the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG 2014, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems 2015 and policy DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to occupation of any of the unit/s hereby approved, a Fire Safety Strategy for the relevant unit/s shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority demonstrating conformity with the submitted Fire Statement (SOCOTEC, dated 16/06/2022) and how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety, including the following details:1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point;2) Appropriate fire alarm systems;3) Passive and active fire safety measures;4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread;5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuation strategy;6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development. The Fire Safety Strategy shall include a statement of competence.The relevant unit/s shall not be occupied other than in accordance with the approved Strategy and thereafter maintained.Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire safety) of the London Plan 2021

In the event that contamination is found (at any time) that was not previously identified, development shall cease and the contamination reported in writing to the local planning authority as soon as is reasonably practicable. An assessment, remediation scheme and verification report shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before development resumes.Reason: To ensure that risks from land contamination are minimised, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Demolition of the existing buildings and erection of commercial units (Use Classes E(g)(iii), B2 and B8) together with access, parking and landscaping.
